content:
The next version of the IG publisher will generate a new fragment and a new file.

  • Fragment "canonical-index.html" - a list of canonical URLs and OIDs with references, ready to drop into a page. @Lloyd McKenzie please add this one to the template somewhere
  • file: "canonicals.json" - will be added directly to the output directory so that software can quickly process the list of canonical URLs, Oids and other URLs defined in the IG. This will will also be generated in the _data directory in case anyone wants to build something from it in a template
Will the URLs be hyperlinks that resolve to the relevant artifact page? How ordered? Thoughts on where this should show up?
it contains a table of id | canonical | oids | other urls sorted by type. The id is a link to the resource. It should show up somewhere as part of a special purpose ToC
Linked from the artifacts page? Does it need to appear on the menu?
yes and no, I think. Certainly to start with - we can see what feedback we get
@Jose Costa Teixeira are you up to adding this?
What is the purpose for having the list of canonical/OIDs? (For me to see where this fits)
If the artifact index is the master index of all artifacts, then this fragment can be added there, at the bottom?
the purpose is so that you can find by oid. UTG in particular needs it, but it would be useful anywhere else. but not enough useful to be on the artifact page itself
What about a dedicated "references" page? Could be a submenu of Artifacts, sibling of artifact index
If this meets the purpose, I suggest we start like this, and depending on feedback we can always change.
nobody outside this stream is going to know what "Canonical Index" means ( a list of Hoewitzers?) how about List of URL's ?
and put at end where all indexes naturally belong
